required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Dialysability of Dotarem® in Dialysed Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Dialysability of Dotarem® in Dialysed Patients - Phase 1 Clinical Study

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the dialysability of Dotarem®, after an IV injection of 0.1 mmol/kg in patients with chronic renal failure who require hemodialysis treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
Ten adult patients suffering from end stage renal failure and requiring hemodialysis treatment for 3 times were enrolled. Patients received a single dose of Dotarem® at 0.1 mmol/kg before being submitted to hemodialysis to assess the dialysability of Dotarem® . After injection of Dotarem®, 3 sessions of hemodialysis were performed as follows:
The first hemodialysis session started between 1 to 2 h after the injection; The second hemodialysis session occurred 2 days (i.e., 48 ± 2 h) after the Dotarem® injection; The third hemodialysis session occurred 4 days (i.e., 96 ± 4 h) after the Dotarem® injection.
The decrease in serum Dotarem® concentration was assessed after each hemodialysis session. Safety assessments included adverse events (AEs), vital signs, injection-site tolerance, and laboratory assessments.Two safety follow-up visits were performed: one 3 weeks (± 2 days) and one 3 months (± 4 days) after the Dotarem® injection.

primary_outcome.measure: Dialysability of Dotarem® in Dialysed Patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: Dotarem® dialysability assessed up to 4 days after Dotarem® administration
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the decrease in seric concentration of gadolinium, after each hemodialysis session of patients injected with 0.1 mmol/kg of Dotarem® . The percent change of gadolinium concentration is calculated by estimating the amount of serum gadolinium before and after each hemodialysis session. Calculations are performed only for subjects with concentration above the lower limit of quantification (LLQ)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of Dotarem® in Dialysed Patients Evaluated by the Number of Patients Experiencing Adverse Events.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Safety assessed from patients inclusion until the last follow-up visit 3 months after Dotarem® administration
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the biological and clinical safety of Dotarem® by assessing vital signs, biological parameters, injection-site tolerance, through a 4-day post injection follow-up, adverse events through a 3-week post injection period and serious adverse events through a 3-month post injection period.

arm_group.description: Male or female subjects, aged ≥18 years,suffering from end-stage renal failure and requiring hemodialysis treatment 3 times per week, were submitted to a single Dotarem® IV injection at 0.1 mmol/kg before being submitted to 3 hemodialysis sessions to assess the decrease of Dotarem® concentration in the blood.

intervention.description: Dotarem® was IV administered at a dose of 0.1 mmoL/kg (0.2 mL/kg).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Male or female, aged ≥18 years
- Subjects suffering from end-stage renal failure who require hemodialysis treatment for 3 times per week (or equivalent to allow overnight dialysis being rescheduled as appropriate per protocol)
- Female Subjects with effective contraception (contraceptive pill or Intra-Uterine Device), or surgically sterilized or post-menopausal (minimum 12 months amenorrhea)
- Subjects having provided their written informed consent to participate in the trial
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known allergy to gadolinium chelates
- Pregnant, breast feeding, or planning to become pregnant during the trial
- Having received or scheduled to be injected with any contrast agent within 7 days before or after the Dotarem® injection
- Schedule to receive erythropoietin (EPO) or iron therapy during 1 week after the Dotarem® injection
- Evidence of human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection and/or positive human HIV antibodies
- Evidence of hepatitis C and/or positive hepatitis C antibody and/or positive hepatitis B surface antigen
- History of hypersensitivity to drugs with a similar chemical structure

clinical_study.keyword: Safety and dialysability of Dotarem in dialysed patients

group.title: Dotarem® Injected Patients
group.description: Male or female, aged ≥18 years • Subjects suffering from end-stage renal failure who require hemodialysis treatment for 3 times per week (or equivalent to allow overnight dialysis being rescheduled as appropriate per protocol) Dotarem®: Dotarem® was administered at a dose of 0.1 mmoL/kg (0.2 mL/kg).

baseline.population: No statistical calculation of sample size was done. According to the literature, a sample of 10 patients was judged sufficient to evaluate the dialysability of Dotarem®.

group.title: Dotarem®-Injected Patients
group.description: Male or female, aged ≥18 years • Subjects suffering from end-stage renal failure who require hemodialysis treatment for 3 times per week (or equivalent to allow overnight dialysis being rescheduled as appropriate per protocol) Dotarem®: Dotarem® was administered at a dose of 0.1 mmoL/kg (0.2 mL/kg).

outcome.title: Dialysability of Dotarem® in Dialysed Patients
outcome.description: To evaluate the decrease in seric concentration of gadolinium, after each hemodialysis session of patients injected with 0.1 mmol/kg of Dotarem® . The percent change of gadolinium concentration is calculated by estimating the amount of serum gadolinium before and after each hemodialysis session. Calculations are performed only for subjects with concentration above the lower limit of quantification (LLQ)
outcome.time_frame: Dotarem® dialysability assessed up to 4 days after Dotarem® administration
outcome.population: After second hemodialysis, 3 subjects had Gd concentration<LLQ and are not included in the analysis; after third hemodialysis, 8 subjects had Gd concentration<LLQ and are not included in the analysis

class.title: Percent change at 0.5h after first hemodialysis
Percent change at 1.5h after first hemodialysis
Percent change at 4h after first hemodialysis
Percent change at 4h after second hemodialysis n=7
Percent change at 4h after third hemodialysis n=2

outcome.title: Safety of Dotarem® in Dialysed Patients Evaluated by the Number of Patients Experiencing Adverse Events.
outcome.description: To evaluate the biological and clinical safety of Dotarem® by assessing vital signs, biological parameters, injection-site tolerance, through a 4-day post injection follow-up, adverse events through a 3-week post injection period and serious adverse events through a 3-month post injection period.
outcome.time_frame: Safety assessed from patients inclusion until the last follow-up visit 3 months after Dotarem® administration

group.title: Dotarem® Injected Patients
group.description: Male or female, aged ≥18 years • Subjects suffering from end-stage renal failure who require hemodialysis treatment for 3 times per week (or equivalent to allow overnight dialysis being rescheduled as appropriate per protocol)

measure.title: Safety of Dotarem® in Dialysed Patients Evaluated by the Number of Patients Experiencing Adverse Events.
measure.description: To evaluate the biological and clinical safety of Dotarem® by assessing vital signs, biological parameters, injection-site tolerance, through a 4-day post injection follow-up, adverse events through a 3-week post injection period and serious adverse events through a 3-month post injection period.

outcome.title: Percent Change in Gadolinium Serum Concentration 4h After Second Hemodialysis Session, Estimated From Subjects With Concentration Data Above the Limit of Detection
outcome.description: Evaluation of the decrease in seric concentration of gadolinium, 4h after the second hemodialysis session of patients injected with 0.1 mmol/kg of Dotarem®. The percent change of gadolinium concentration was estimated from the concentration of gadolinium after Dotarem® injection. Only subjects with gadolinium concentration above the lower limit of quantification (LLQ) were kept for analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Dotarem® dialysability assessed 4h after second hemodialysis session which took place 2 days after Dotarem® administration
outcome.population: 3 subjects had a gadolinium concentration <LLQ after the second hemodialysis session

group.title: Dotarem® Injected Patients
group.description: Male or female, aged ≥18 years • Subjects suffering from end-stage renal failure who require hemodialysis treatment for 3 times per week (or equivalent to allow overnight dialysis being rescheduled as appropriate per protocol)

measure.title: Percent Change in Gadolinium Serum Concentration 4h After Second Hemodialysis Session, Estimated From Subjects With Concentration Data Above the Limit of Detection
measure.description: Evaluation of the decrease in seric concentration of gadolinium, 4h after the second hemodialysis session of patients injected with 0.1 mmol/kg of Dotarem®. The percent change of gadolinium concentration was estimated from the concentration of gadolinium after Dotarem® injection. Only subjects with gadolinium concentration above the lower limit of quantification (LLQ) were kept for analysis.
measure.population: 3 subjects had a gadolinium concentration <LLQ after the second hemodialysis session

outcome.title: Percent Change in Gadolinium Serum Concentration 4h After Third Hemodialysis Session, Estimated From Subjects With Concentration Data Above the Limit of Detection
outcome.description: The evaluation of the decrease in seric concentration of gadolinium, 4h after the third hemodialysis session of patients injected with 0.1 mmol/kg of Dotarem®. The percent change of gadolinium concentration was estimated from the concentration of gadolinium after Dotarem® injection. Only subjects with gadolinium concentration above the lower limit of detection were kept for analysis.
outcome.time_frame: Dotarem® dialysability assessed 4h after third hemodialysis session which took place 4 days after Dotarem® administration
outcome.population: 8 subjects had a gadolinium concentration <LLQ after third hemodialysis session

The percent change of gadolinium concentration was estimated from the concentration of gadolinium after Dotarem® injection. Only subjects with gadolinium concentration above the lower limit of detection were kept for analysis.
measure.population: 8 subjects had a gadolinium concentration <LLQ after third hemodialysis session

reported_events.time_frame: Safety assessment was performed at the day 1, day 2, and day 4 after Dotarem® injection. Two safety follow-up visits were performed at 3 weeks (+/- 2 days) and at 3 months (+/- 4 days) after Dotarem® injection.
reported_events.desc: Adverse events (AEs) were followed from the subject’s screening to the first safety follow-up visit (3 weeks +/- 2 days after the Dotarem® injection). At the second safety follow-up visit (3 months +/- 4 days after the Dotarem® injection), only Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) were evaluated.

group.title: Dotarem® Injected Patients
group.description: Male or female, aged ≥18 years • Subjects suffering from end-stage renal failure who require hemodialysis treatment for 3 times per week (or equivalent to allow overnight dialysis being rescheduled as appropriate per protocol) Dotarem: Dotarem® was administered at a single dose of 0.1 mmoL/kg (0.2 mL/kg).

event.description: This adverse event was considered as not related to the Dotarem® injection.

Five days after Dotarem® injection subject experienced moderate sepsis deemed not related. Subject was hospitalized and recovered after 15 days following antibiotic treatment. This AE was considered as not related to the Dotarem® injection.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: No unpublished data given to the investigator may be transmitted to a third party without approval by the sponsor. The data are the exclusive property of Guerbet. The investigator undertakes to submit to Guerbet any articles or papers related to this study within 30 days of their submission to journals or congresses. All publications must have the joint agreement of the investigator and the sponsor. The investigator remains independent with no relationship of subordination with Guerbet.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Dr. Pierre Desché, MD - VP Development, Medical and Regulatory Affairs
